bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory holdin at Tacoma (to wit: Tacoma) in and for the County of Pierce
John Lainmeister and John Tod Plaintiff vs. W. C. Shattuch Defendant}
John Lanmesiter & John Tod the plaintiffs in the above entitled action, complaining of W. C. Shattuch the defendant therein, respectfully show:
That at all times herein after mentioned the plaintiffs were and still are copartners in business under the name or style Lanmeister & Tod

That at dines times between the first day of October 1884 and the sixth day of December, 1884, both inclusive, at Tacoma in said county,
the plaintiffs as copartners as aforesaid sold and delivered to the defendant goods, wares and merchandise at the agreed price in the aggregate of two hundred and fourteen dollars and seventy one cents ($214.71)

That no part of said amount has been paid and that there is now due and owing from the defendant to the plaintiffs as copartners as above named for said goods so as aforesaid sold and delivered the whole of the above mentioned sum with interest thereon from said such day of December, 1884

Whereupon the plaintiffs demands judgment against the defendant for the said sum of two hundred and fourteen dollars and seventy one cents ($214.71) with interest thereon from the said sixth day of December, 1884, besides the costs of this action.
